entry.title: I got a little lost when I received the reward
entry.summary: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … I got a little lost when I received the rewardIt was a little disorienting, to say the least, when I received the email notification that I had won a contest. I wasn’t expecting it at all and, to be honest, I don’t think I had even entered one. But there it was in my inbox, congratulations on being a winner!It took me a few minutes to figure out what I had won, and then a few more to track down the contest entry form. As it turns out, I had entered a contest several months ago and forgotten all about it. The prize was a $100 gift card to a store I love.While it was exciting to receive the notification and prize, it did leave me feeling a little lost. I realized that I had let myself forget about an ongoing contest and, as a result, had missed out on the opportunity to maybe win something bigger.It’s a good reminder to stay aware of the contests you’ve entered and to keep track of them, even if you don’t think you’ll win. Because you just never know!

entry.title: he went full cuteness mode
entry.summary: he went full cuteness mode When it comes to getting attention, few things are as effective as cuteness. And when someone really wants to lay it on thick, they’ll go full cuteness mode. Whether it’s a baby making faces, a puppy wagging its tail, or a kitten playing with a ball of string, the power of cuteness is undeniable. And when someone really wants to ramp up the cute factor, they’ll go all out. They might make faces, use a high-pitched voice, or dress up in a cutesy outfit. Whatever the method, the goal is always the same: to look as adorable as possible. While it might seem like a desperate move, there’s actually a lot of strategy involved in going full cuteness mode. After all, it’s not easy to pull off. But when it’s done well, it can be extremely effective. So next time you see someone going full cuteness mode, don’t be too quick to judge. They might just be trying to get your attention. And who knows? They might just succeed.

entry.title: I got in trouble if I changed the location of the toilet
entry.summary: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … If you’re thinking about moving the toilet in your home, think again. It may seem like a good idea to change the location of the toilet, but there are a few things you need to consider before you make the change.For starters, the location of the toilet is determined by the home’s sewer line. The sewer line is the pipe that carries waste water from the home to the municipal sewer system. The location of the sewer line is typically governed by building codes, which means that if you move the toilet, you may also need to move the sewer line. This can be a costly and time-consuming project.Additionally, the toilet is connected to the home’s water supply. This means that if you move the toilet, you’ll also need to reroute the water supply lines. This can be a tricky process, and if it’s not done correctly, it could result in a leak.Finally, you need to take into account the fact that the toilet is one of the most-used fixtures in the home. This means that relocating it could be a major inconvenience for you and your family.Therefore, before you make the decision to move the toilet, weigh the pros and cons carefully. It may be best to leave the toilet where it is.

entry.title: “Guys, look! The tube is back!”
entry.summary: “Guys, look! The tube is back!” After a long day at work, there is nothing better than coming home and plopping down in front of the TV to relax. But what if your TV is broken? You may be in for a long, frustrating night. But don’t despair! There are a few things you can do to try to fix your TV. First, check all the connections. Make sure the power cord is plugged in and that the TV is set to the correct input. If everything looks good there, try pressing the power button again. If your TV still won’t turn on, there could be a problem with the power supply. Try unplugging the TV for a few minutes and then plugging it back in. If that doesn’t work, you may need to replace the power supply. If your TV turns on but there is no picture, the first thing to check is the input. Make sure you have selected the correct input. If that doesn’t work, try adjusting the antenna or cable connection. If you’re still having problems, it’s time to call a TV repairman. But don’t give up hope! With a little troubleshooting, you may be able to fix your TV yourself.

entry.title: BEST Ferret TikToks 2022
My wife got this picture and it made my three look like Cerberus
entry.summary: My wife got this picture and it made my three look like Cerberus Cerberus, also known as the “hellhound”, is a fearsome creature from Greek mythology. He is said to have three heads, each of which can breathe fire, and he guards the entrance to the Underworld. So it’s no wonder that one father was surprised to see his three young children pictured with the dog-like creature in a photo his wife had taken. The children are pictured looking up at the camera with Cerberus in the background, and the father is clearly amazed by the resemblance. While it is certainly an unusual picture, it is also a very cute one. It’s clear that the children are not afraid of the so-called “hellhound” and, in fact, seem to be quite fond of him. This is just one example of the power of imagination and the ability of children to see the world in a different way to adults. It’s a reminder that, sometimes, the seemingly impossible can be completely believable to those with less experience of the world.

entry.title: 5 More Things You Need To Know Before Owning A Ferret
entry.summary: Here Are 5 More Things You Need To Know Before Getting A Ferret. These Tips Are More On The Fun-er Side Of Things. Ferrets are wonderful, playful pets that will bring you endless hours of joy – but before you rushes out to buy one, there are a few things you should know. Here are 5 more things you need to know before owning a ferret:1. They’re high energyFerrets are high energy creatures that need to be constantly active – if they’re not, they can become depressed or even ill. A good way to keep your ferret healthy and happy is to provide them with plenty of toys and playtime.2. They have a strong sense of smellFerrets have a very strong sense of smell, which can be both a good and a bad thing. On the plus side, this means they’re great at finding things – but it also means they can be quite smelly creatures! Be sure to clean their cage regularly and provide them with fresh bedding to help control the odor.3. They’re escape artistsFerrets are known for their escape artist tendencies, so it’s important to make sure their cage is well-secured. If your ferret does manage to escape, don’t be surprised if they end up in some unlikely places – they’re very good at finding their way around!4. They’re social creaturesFerrets are very social creatures and love to interact with their human companions. They can be quite playful, and many enjoy being held and cuddled. If you’re considering getting a ferret, be prepared to spend plenty of time playing with and caring for them.5. They have a relatively short lifespanFerrets have a relatively short lifespan compared to other pets, typically living for 6 to 8 years. This is something to keep in mind when deciding whether or not a ferret is the right pet for you.If you’re considering adding a ferret to your family, be sure to do your research and consider all of the pros and cons before making your decision. With a little preparation, you’ll be well on your way to enjoying many years of ferret ownership!

entry.title: Photos from The Modern Ferret's post
entry.summary: Big news everyone! I adopted a new ferret! He is two years old and his name will be revealed when I post my upcoming YouTube video that talks all about him! How he landed in my lap is a funny story too, which I’ll talk all about soon! Stuff I love about this little dude: he naps with me in my hammock, he follows me everywhere, and he war dances like crazy! Also, my dream was always to have a ferret that would happily CHOOSE to sleep on the bed with me. Well, one day recently my little dude figured out how to climb up my bed. And what did he do once he got there? Promptly curled up and fell asleep. He has been such a blessing during this time in my life. He does remind me a lot of Moose. More info to come! Love you all! #ferret #ferrets #ferretsofinstagram(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title: Pet Owner Appeals for Return of Stolen Ferrets as Hunting Season Approaches - Newsweek
entry.summary: A worried pet owner fears her eight ferrets that were snatched from her garden might be used to hunt rabbits and is appealing for help to get them back.Jessica Swadling, 27, said the five adults and three babies vanished from a communal garden she shares with neighbors in Maidstone, the largest town in the county of Kent, England.Swadling said the animals were pets that had never worked in their lives, but thinks since rabbit season is approaching, her beloved ferrets may have been swiped to hunt.She said the animals - Cinder, Rapunzel, Maui, Sookie, Dexter, Otis, Moana and Alfalfa -were much loved by friends and neighbors, especially children.Sookie the ferret is pictured in an undated photo. Jessica Swadling, Sookie's owner, fears her eight ferrets that were snatched from her garden migh…

entry.title: SPCA of Westchester offers free rabies shots Saturday for pet dogs, cats, ferrets - CBS New York
entry.summary: By CBS New York Team August 27, 2022 / 11:00 AM / CBS New York Free rabies shots for pets at Westchester SPCA Free rabies shots for pets at Westchester SPCA 00:20 BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y. -- Westchester County residents can get free rabies vaccine shots for their dogs, cats and ferrets on Saturday. They're being offered from 10 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. at the SPCA of Westchester on North State Road in Briarcliff Manor. Appointments are required, so it's best to call ahead before brining pets in for their shots. First published on August 27, 2022 / 11:00 AM © 2022 CBS Broadcasting Inc. All Rights Reserved.

entry.title: Phoenix Zoo gives names to 4 newborn ferret kits after online contest - KTAR.com
entry.summary:
PHOENIX — The Phoenix Zoo gave names to four of its new 21 endangered black-footed ferret kits through voting from Valley residents online. With over 2,100 votes, the names selected in a landslide were Maple, Acacia, Cedar and Willow, according to a press release. The Phoenix Zoo is one of six zoos worldwide that breeds black-footed ferrets, one of the most endangered North American species, that ultimately get released back into the wild. “We are thrilled to have another successful black-footed ferret breeding season and excited for these little kits to grow up and contribute to the recovery of their species,” Director of Conservation and Science at the Phoenix Zoo. Dr. Tara Harris said. The zoo has produced over 500 black-footed ferrets in the 30 years that it has been breeding the animals. In 2021, 13 ferrets were released back into the wild in Colorado. The kits live in specially designed den boxes with their mothers, according to the release,
Have a story idea or tip? Pass it along to the KTAR News team here.

entry.title: Emaciated dog, 5 ferrets rescued by Animal Charity - WKBN.com
entry.summary: AUSTINTOWN, Ohio (WKBN) – A neglected dog and five ferrets are safe after being rescued by an Animal Charity humane agent Thursday. “Someone left them there intentionally. Tyson is extremely underweight. He is starved, almost to death,” said Jane MacMurchy, operations director at Animal Charity. Tyson weighed only 46 pounds. He was found in an abandoned Austintown apartment, collapsed in a bathroom, unable to stand, according to an Animal Charity Facebook post. “This wasn’t just a situation where maybe somebody left their animal with somebody else to take care of, you know it was very clear that they were intentionally abandoned and left to starve,” MacMurchy said. MacMurchy says Tyson was cached with urine and feces, because he couldn’t stand up to use the bathroom. She said the ferrets were dehydrated and lethargic. “It took a village to save Tyson and five ferrets seemingly left to die in an apartment yesterday,” the post stated. Animal Charity did not have a vet on staff yesterday so they called Friends Of Fido MCDP and Tyson was rushed to a local vet clinic for emergency care. Tyson was given lifesaving fluids and started on small meals to slowly reintroduce his body to food. He was also given a bath to remove the caked-on feces and urine. The ferrets were given lifesaving fluids and a slow introduction to food as well. MacMurchy says they will be pressing criminal charges against the owner, which may include animal cruelty and prohibitions concerning animals. “The first step is the probable cause hearing, then the next step is to pursue criminal charges,” she said. Both Tyson and the ferrets are doing well and in the care of Animal Charity. Copyright 2022 Nexstar Media Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
